p.bold: Corrections to the article ‘The “human” as referent object? Humanitarianism as securitization’, by Scott Watson, Security Dialogue 42(1): 3–20.

p.italic: In the above article, although information directing readers to the original source material was provided, quotation marks were omitted for a number of direct citations. The author apologizes for this error. Correct details are specified below.

body.p: Page 3, 1st paragraph, lines 3–4. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘the intersubjective establishment of an existential threat with sufficient saliency to have political effects’ (Buzan et al., 1998: 25).
Page 4, 1st paragraph, line 1. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘the normal political rules of the game’ (Buzan et al., 1998: 24).
Page 4, 4th paragraph, lines 1–2. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘lacks rigid conceptual boundaries’ and ‘facilitates ambiguous and manipulative uses’ (Chimni, 2000: 244).
Page 4, 4th paragraph, line 5. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘essentially contested concept’ (Buzan, 1991).
Pages 4–5, 4th paragraph, line 7. Quotation and ellipsis marks should be added for ‘power holders ... to use the instrument of security to gain control over an issue’ (Wæver, 1995: 54–5).

Page 5, 2nd paragraph, line 6 and 3rd paragraph, line 10. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘logic of threat and vulnerabilities’ and ‘logic of threats and vulnerability’, respectively. The original formulation, from Buzan et al. (1998: 57) is ‘logic of threats and vulnerabilities’.
Page 5, 3rd paragraph, line 6. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘the nature of survival and of existential threats differs across sectors and types of units’ (Buzan et al., 1998: 27).
Page 5, 5th paragraph, line 4. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘promotion of human welfare’ and ‘alleviation of human suffering’ (Weiss and Minear, 1995: 18).
Page 6, 2nd paragraph, line 3. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘maddeningly imprecise’ and ‘rigid conceptual boundaries’ (Weiss and Minear, 1995: 18; Chimni, 2000: 244, respectively).

Page 7, 1st paragraph, lines 1–7. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘relief and nothing but relief’, ‘slightly more ambitious’, ‘remove root causes of violence and create pacific dispositions’, ‘negotiating with those capable of ending violence’, and ‘to create a stable cease-fire and improve local conditions’ (Barnett and Snyder, 2008: 147–54).
Page 7, 4th paragraph, line 4. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘below the level of exceptionality’ (Stritzel, 2007: 367).

Pages 7–8, 4th paragraph, last line. Quotation and ellipsis marks should be added to ‘if a given type of threat is persistent or recurrent ... the response and the sense of urgency become institutionalized’, and quotation marks inserted around ‘standing bureaucracies, procedures and military establishments to deal with the threats’ (Buzan et al., 1998: 27).
Page 8, 2nd paragraph, line 11. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘gradual and incremental’ and ‘moving directly from normalcy to emergency’ (Abrahamsen, 2005: 71).
Page 8, 3rd paragraph, line 13. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘modality of threat-urgency’ (Hansen and Nissenbaum, 2009: 1159).
Page 9, 1st paragraph, lines 1–2. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘modality of threat-urgency’ (see previous erratum).

Page 9, 2nd paragraph, lines 10–11. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘Western militaries have often participated in humanitarian relief efforts’ and ‘on an ad hoc basis’ (Weiss and Campbell, 1991: 453).
Page 10, 3rd paragraph, line 5. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘principles of sovereignty and non-interference’ (Weiss and Campbell, 1991: 454).

Page 10, 4th paragraph, lines 4–5. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘mutually exclusive, territorially bounded spaces’ and around ‘bounded territory’ (Soguk, 1999: 11; Nyers, 2006: xi, respectively).

Page 10, 4th paragraph, lines 11–12. Quotation marks and brackets should be inserted for ‘reaffirm[s] the “normal” territorial order of life activities around the constellation of citizen/nation/state’ (Soguk, 1999: 11–12).
Page 11, 1st paragraph, lines 1–2. Remove both sets of quotation marks from ‘“temporality” of the status of the refugee’.

Page 11, 1st paragraph, line 4. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘routine world order activity’ (Buzan et al., 1998: 22). The hyphen between ‘world’ and ‘order’ in the printed version should be deleted.
Page 11, 3rd paragraph, line 14. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘amenable to securitization as durable referent objects’ (Buzan et al., 1998: 36).
Page 12, 3rd paragraph, line 5. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘reified, monolithic forms of identity are declared’ (Williams, 2003: 519).
Page 13, 3rd paragraph, line 6. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘threat-urgency modality’. The citation is from Hansen and Nissembaum (2009: 1159).
Page 13, 4th paragraph, line 9. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘attributed opinions’ (Zaller, 1992: 315).

Page 14, 2nd paragraph, lines 5–6. Quotation marks and brackets should be inserted for ‘shared location from which [individuals] from different cultural and social contexts can identify’ (Kapur, 2002: 5).
Page 14, 2nd paragraph, line 16. ‘(Rieff, 2005: 55)’ should read ‘(Rieff, 2005: 35)’.
Page 14, 3rd paragraph, lines 3–4. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘discursive registers’, ‘physical evidence’, ‘human tragedy’ and ‘technical/heroic narratives’ (Malkki, 1996: 392–3).
Page 16, 1st paragraph, lines 6–7. Quotation marks should be inserted around ‘extending the very economic practices that contribute to poverty’. The quotation is from Bellamy (2003: 333).
